com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.inputs

Class DatastoreKeyInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.Input<V>
      • com.google.appengine.tools.mapreduce.inputs.DatastoreKeyInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class DatastoreKeyInput
extends Input<V>
    An input to read entity keys of a specified kind from the datastore.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatastoreKeyInput

        public DatastoreKeyInput(String entityKind,
                 int shardCount)
        Parameters:
        entityKind - entity kind to read from the datastore.
        shardCount - number of parallel shards for the input.

      • DatastoreKeyInput

        public DatastoreKeyInput(String entityKind,
                 int shardCount,
                 String namespace)
        Parameters:
        entityKind - entity kind to read from the datastore.
        shardCount - the number of parallel shards to divide the input into.
        namespace - the namespace of the entities (if null will use current).

      • DatastoreKeyInput

        public DatastoreKeyInput(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Query query,
                 int shardCount)
        Parameters:
        query - The query to map read from the datastore
        shardCount - the number of parallel shards to divide the input into.

    • Method Detail

      • createReader

        protected DatastoreKeyInputReader createReader(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Query query)

      • createReaders

        public List<InputReader<V>> createReaders()
        Description copied from class: Input
        Returns a list of readers for this input. It is the Input's responsibility to determine an appropriate number of readers to split into. This could be specified by the user or determined algorithmically. The number of input readers returned determines the number of map shards.
        Specified by:
        createReaders in class Input<V>

      • getShardCount

        public int getShardCount()
